io.github.goodees.ese.core.dispatch

Interface DispatcherConfiguration

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    DispatchingEventSourcingRuntime.RuntimeDispatcherConfiguration

    public interface DispatcherConfiguration
    Dependencies and strategies for Dispatcher.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods

      <R extends Request<RS>,RS>

    • Method Detail

      • dispatcherName

        String dispatcherName()

      • executorService

        ExecutorService executorService()
        The thread pool execution of request should run on. Agent invocations will be invoked within this thread pool.
        Returns:
        the executor service instance

      • schedulerService

        ScheduledExecutorService schedulerService()
        Threadpool for scheduling requests to be delivered in the future and handling timeouts. Should be different from executorService!. When same thread pools would be used, and the execution would block, the unsatisfied requests would not be cancelled as there would be no free threads to perform the cancellation.
        Returns:
        scheduled executor service instance

      • execute

        <R extends Request<RS>,RS> void execute(String id,
                                        R request,
                                        java.util.function.BiConsumer<RS,Throwable> callback)
        Invoke request on the entity, pass the result to the callback.

        This method will be called on the executor thread when the request is due for execution

        .
        Type Parameters:
        R - type of request
        RS - type of response
        Parameters:
        id - id of the entity
        request - request to process
        callback - callback to call upon completion

      • retryDelay

        long retryDelay(String id,
                Request<?> request,
                Throwable t,
                int completedAttempts)
        Decide whether and when the request should be retried in case of failure. Should return redelivery delay in milliseconds. Returning 0 means to retry immediately, returning less than 0 means not to retry.

        If retry is greater than zero, the dispatcher may execute other requests before the wait period expires

        Parameters:
        id - identity of the entity
        request - request that failed
        t - the throwable the request failed with
        completedAttempts - number of attempts for execution of that request. Greater than 1.
        Returns:
        negative in order to fail the request, zero to immediately retry ir, positive for delay in ms until next attempt
